## RuntimeContext interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface RuntimeContext 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [appData](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.appdata.md) | [AppRuntimeData](./stentor-models.appruntimedata.md) | App data used at runtime. |
|  [environment](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.environment.md) | "dev" \| "stage" \| "prod" \| "production" | Current environment |
|  [headers](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.headers.md) | any | The headers for the request |
|  [ovai](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.ovai.md) | [StudioContext](./stentor-models.studiocontext.md) | Context specific to One Voice AI |
|  [rawBody](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.rawbody.md) | string | The request body as a string.<!-- -->This is extremely important when verifying the payload comes from Alexa. It must be exactly how it comes in. It cannot be JSON.parsed then JSON.stringified as the order is important for certification. |
|  [studio](./stentor-models.runtimecontext.studio.md) | [StudioContext](./stentor-models.studiocontext.md) | Context specific to the setup within OC Studio |
